lines.value: aronow v united states was the first case to challenge the inclusion of in god we trust on us currency
lines.name: English

lines.value: the law it challenged was 31 usc  324a the inscription in god we trust'...shall appear on all united states currency and coins
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1970 stefan ray aronow having been found without standing to sue by the district court appealed his case to the united states court of appeals for the ninth circuit challenging the use of expressions of trust in god by the united states government on its coinage currency official documents and publications
lines.name: English

lines.value: specifically the action challenged the constitutionality as repugnant to the establishment clause of the first amendment of two federal statutes the appeals court following the precedent of massachusetts v mellon agreed with the district court that the plaintiff did not have standing as a taxpayer and citizen but set aside the question of standing to rule on the merits of the case
lines.name: English

lines.value: the court ruled it is quite obvious that the national motto and the slogan on coinage and currency in god we trust has nothing whatsoever to do with the establishment of religion
lines.name: English

lines.value: its use is of patriotic or ceremonial character and bears no true resemblance to a governmental sponsorship of a religious exercise
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is not easy to discern any religious significance attendant the payment of a bill with coin or currency on which has been imprinted in god we trust or the study of a government publication or document bearing that slogan
lines.name: English

lines.value: in fact such secular uses of the motto was viewed as sacrilegious and irreverent by president theodore roosevelt
lines.name: English

lines.value: yet congress has directed such uses
lines.name: English

lines.value: while ceremonial and patriotic may not be particularly apt words to describe the category of the national motto it is excluded from first amendment significance because the motto has no theological or ritualistic impact
lines.name: English

lines.value: as stated by the congressional report it has spiritual and psychological value and inspirational quality the court cited engel v vitale which held there is of course nothing in the decision reached here [banning government led prayer in public schools] that is inconsistent with the fact that school children and others are officially encouraged to express love for our country by...such patriotic or ceremonial occasions bear no true resemblance to the unquestioned religious exercise that the state of new york has sponsored in this instance
lines.name: English

lines.value: the court held the practice was constitutional using the reasoning established in mcgowan v maryland
lines.name: English

lines.value: the court maintained that the national motto has no purpose in a coercive power to aid religion neither on the face of the legislation nor in its operative effect its practical impact on society
lines.name: English

lines.value: the court also cited the supreme court of the united states decision of walz v tax commission quoting the course of constitutional neutrality in this area cannot be an absolutely straight line...the general principle deducible from the first amendment and all that has been said by the court is this that we will not tolerate either governmentally established religion or governmental interference with religion
lines.name: English

lines.value: short of those expressly proscribed governmental acts there is room for play in the joints productive of a benevolent neutrality which will permit religious exercise to exist without sponsorship and without interference
lines.name: English

lines.value: adherence to the policy of neutrality that derives from an accommodation of the establishment and free exercise clauses has prevented the kind of involvement that would tip the balance toward government control of churches or governmental restraint on religious practice
lines.name: English

lines.value: the supreme court declined to hear an appeal of the case
lines.name: English

lines.value: a similar decision was reached by the fifth circuit in madalyn murray o'hair vs w michael blumenthal in 1979 which affirmed that the primary purpose of the slogan was secular
lines.name: English

lines.value: loki's origins and role in norse mythology which some scholars have described as that of a trickster god have been much debated by scholars

lines.value: the etymology of the name loki has been extensively debated
lines.name: English

lines.value: the name has at times been associated with the old norse word logi flame but there seems not to be a sound linguistic basis for this
lines.name: English

lines.value: rather the later scandinavian variants of the name such as faroese lokki danish lokkemand norwegian loke and lokke swedish luki and luku along with finnish lukki point to an origin in the germanic root *luk- which denoted things to do with loops like knots hooks closed off rooms and locks
lines.name: English

lines.value: this corresponds with usages such as the swedish lokkanat and faroese lokkanet cobweb literally lokke's web and faroese lokki~grindalokki~grindalokkur daddy-long-legs associated in pre modern folk taxonomy with spiders
lines.name: English

lines.value: some eastern swedish traditions referring to the same figure use forms in n like nokk(e but this corresponds to the *luk etymology insofar as those dialects consistently used a different root germanic *hnuk- in contexts where western varieties used *luk- nokke corresponds to nokkel key in eastern scandinavian as loki~lokke to lykil key in western scandinavian
lines.name: English

lines.value: while it has been suggested that this association with closing could point to loki's apocalyptic role at ragnarok there is quite a bit of evidence that loki in premodern society was thought to be the causer of knots/tangles/loops or himself a knot/tangle/loop
lines.name: English

lines.value: hence it is natural that loki is the inventor of the fishnet which consists of loops and knots and that the word loki lokke lokki loke luki is a term for makers of cobwebs spiders and the like though not prominent in the oldest sources this identity as a tangler may be the etymological meaning of loki's name

lines.value: the main argument for this is that the gods odin hnir and loki occur as a trio in haustlong in the prose prologue to reginsmal and also in the loka tattur a faroese ballad an example of norse deities appearing in later folklore

lines.value: lua (, from meaning moon is a lightweight multi paradigm programming language designed primarily for embedded use in applications
lines.name: English

lines.value: lua is cross platform since the interpreter is written in ansi c and has a relatively simple c api
lines.name: English

lines.value: lua was originally designed in 1993 as a language for extending software applications to meet the increasing demand for customization at the time
lines.name: English

lines.value: it provided the basic facilities of most procedural programming languages but more complicated or domain specific features were not included rather it included mechanisms for extending the language allowing programmers to implement such features
lines.name: English

lines.value: as lua was intended to be a general embeddable extension language the designers of lua focused on improving its speed portability extensibility and ease of use in development
lines.name: English

lines.value: lua was created in 1993 by roberto ierusalimschy luiz henrique de figueiredo and waldemar celes members of the computer graphics technology group tecgraf at the pontifical catholic university of rio de janeiro in brazil
lines.name: English

lines.value: from 1977 until 1992 brazil had a policy of strong trade barriers called a market reserve for computer hardware and software
lines.name: English

lines.value: in that atmosphere tecgraf's clients could not afford either politically or financially to buy customized software from abroad
lines.name: English

lines.value: those reasons led tecgraf to implement the basic tools it needed from scratch
lines.name: English

lines.value: lua's predecessors were the data description/configuration languages sol simple object language and del data-entry language
lines.name: English

lines.value: they had been independently developed at tecgraf in 1992 1993 to add some flexibility into two different projects both were interactive graphical programs for engineering applications at petrobras company
lines.name: English

lines.value: there was a lack of any flow control structures in sol and del and petrobras felt a growing need to add full programming power to them
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the evolution of lua the language's authors wrote lua 1.0 was designed in such a way that its object constructors being then slightly different from the current light and flexible style incorporated the data description syntax of sol hence the name lua sol is also the portuguese word for sun lua being the word for moon
lines.name: English

lines.value: lua syntax for control structures was mostly borrowed from modula but also had taken influence from clu multiple assignments and multiple returns from function calls as a simpler alternative to reference parameters or explicit pointers c++ neat idea of allowing a local variable to be declared only where we need it ), snobol and awk associative arrays
lines.name: English

lines.value: in an article published in dr dobb's journal lua's creators also state that lisp and scheme with their single ubiquitous data structure mechanism the list were a major influence on their decision to develop the table as the primary data structure of lua
lines.name: English

lines.value: lua semantics have been increasingly influenced by scheme over time especially with the introduction of anonymous functions and full lexical scoping
lines.name: English

lines.value: several features were added in new lua versions
lines.name: English

lines.value: versions of lua prior to version 5.0 were released under a license similar to the bsd license
lines.name: English

lines.value: from version 5.0 onwards lua has been licensed under the mit license
lines.name: English

lines.value: both are permissive free software licences and are almost identical
lines.name: English

lines.value: lua is commonly described as a multi paradigm language providing a small set of general features that can be extended to fit different problem types
lines.name: English

lines.value: lua does not contain explicit support for inheritance but allows it to be implemented with metatables
lines.name: English

lines.value: similarly lua allows programmers to implement namespaces classes and other related features using its single table implementation first class functions allow the employment of many techniques from functional programming and full lexical scoping allows fine grained information hiding to enforce the principle of least privilege
lines.name: English

lines.value: in general lua strives to provide simple flexible meta features that can be extended as needed rather than supply a feature set specific to one programming paradigm
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a result the base language is light the full reference interpreter is only about 180 kb compiled -and easily adaptable to a broad range of applications
lines.name: English

lines.value: lua is a dynamically typed language intended for use as an extension or scripting language and is compact enough to fit on a variety of host platforms
lines.name: English

lines.value: it supports only a small number of atomic data structures such as boolean values numbers double-precision floating point and 64-bit integers by default and strings
lines.name: English

lines.value: typical data structures such as arrays sets lists and records can be represented using lua's single native data structure the table which is essentially a heterogeneous associative array
lines.name: English

lines.value: lua implements a small set of advanced features such as first class functions garbage collection closures proper tail calls coercion automatic conversion between string and number values at run time coroutines cooperative multitasking and dynamic module loading
lines.name: English

lines.value: a sweat lodge is a low profile hut typically dome shaped or oblong and made with natural materials
lines.name: English

lines.value: the structure is the lodge and the ceremony performed within the structure may be called a purification ceremony or simply a sweat
lines.name: English

lines.value: traditionally the structure is simple constructed of saplings covered with blankets and sometimes animal skins
lines.name: English

lines.value: originally it was only used by some of the indigenous peoples of the americas notably the plains indians but with the rise of pan indianism numerous nations that did not originally have the sweat lodge ceremony have adopted it
lines.name: English

lines.value: this has been controversial
lines.name: English

lines.value: in all cases the sweat is intended as a religious ceremony - it is for prayer and healing and the ceremony is only to be led by elders who know the associated language songs traditions and safety protocols
lines.name: English

lines.value: otherwise the ceremony can be dangerous if performed improperly
lines.name: English

lines.value: sweat lodges have also been used by some non natives in north america and internationally resulting in responses like the lakota declaration of war and similar statements from indigenous elders declaring that these in their view dangerous and disrespectful misappropriations need to stop
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are several styles of structures used in different cultures in addition to the most common domed or oblong structures there are also permanent structures made of wood and earth
lines.name: English

lines.value: stones are typically heated and then water is poured over them to create steam

lines.value: native americans in many regions have sweat lodge ceremonies

lines.value: for example chumash peoples of the central coast of california build sweat lodges in coastal areas in association with habitation sites

lines.value: the ancient mesoamerican tribes of mexico such as the aztec and olmec practiced a sweat bath ceremony known as temazcal as a religious rite of penance and purification
lines.name: English

lines.value: traditions associated with sweating vary regionally and culturally
lines.name: English

lines.value: ceremonies often include traditional prayers and songs
lines.name: English

lines.value: in some cultures drumming and offerings to the spirit world may be part of the ceremony or a sweat lodge ceremony may be a part of another longer ceremony such as a sun dance

lines.name: English

lines.value: covenant is an electronic band formed in 1986 in helsingborg sweden

lines.value: in the late 1970s and early 1980s electronic music and several of its subgenres became a preferred musical style among european underground culture

lines.value: it gained favor initially within major cities and eventually trickled into the continent's more secluded regions
lines.name: English

lines.value: this new wave of music was discovered at different instances by a group of friends living in helsingborg a scenic town in south western sweden
lines.name: English

lines.value: eskil simonsson joakim montelius and clas nachmanson three teenagers with mutual youthful curiosities for science philosophy and matters of existence were all enthralled by the unique presentation and the emotional content of the music specifically by that of bands such as kraftwerk the human league depeche mode front 242 and nitzer ebb
lines.name: English

lines.value: the friends carried this fascination with them to university life in the historic town of lund approximately southeast of helsingborg
lines.name: English

lines.value: in between their academic endeavors and discussions of worldly affairs they assembled a small recording studio in nachmanson's bedroom and began to experiment with their own musical compositions
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1989 the name covenant was selected for the group a name derived from the unspoken spiritual bond the trio professed to share
lines.name: English

lines.value: as covenant the three produced their first publicly released track the replicant by invitation of swedish record label memento materia
lines.name: English

lines.value: the replicant was released on a compilation album in 1992 and the track thrilled label executives prompting them to ask for a full album
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1994 the group compiled enough songs to release the album which became dreams of a cryotank
lines.name: English

lines.value: dreams was well received by critics and fans alike and with its success the boyhood friends decided to take their musical efforts more seriously

lines.value: they upgraded and added more equipment relocated their studio and committed to tour

lines.value: in 1995 covenant performed at a festival in germany at the request of off beat records

lines.value: the band impressed off beat's attending a&r representative who signed them to a record deal the following day
lines.name: English

lines.value: excited by the prospect of broader exposure the band members eased further away from their educational pursuits and devoted themselves to completing a new album 1996's sequencer

lines.value: with sequencer the band sought to improve upon the weaknesses they found in dreams by combining sequencing diverse melodies and commanding lyrics

lines.value: it became an instant classic among many observers some of whom boldly declared it the best electro album of the decade it would go on to be rereleased a number of times throughout the world and remains a club favorite in many settings

lines.value: benjamin earl king born benjamin earl nelson september 28 1938 - april 30 2015 known as ben e king was an american soul and r&b singer and record producer
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was perhaps best known as the singer and co composer of stand by me a us top 10 hit both in 1961 and later in 1986 when it was used as the theme to the film of the same name a number one hit in the uk in 1987 and no
lines.name: English

lines.value: 25 on the riaa's list of songs of the century and as one of the principal lead singers of the r&b vocal group the drifters notably singing the lead vocals of one of their biggest global hit singles and only us 1 hit save the last dance for me
lines.name: English

lines.value: king was born benjamin earl nelson on september 28 1938 in henderson north carolina and moved to harlem new york at the age of nine in 1947
lines.name: English

lines.value: king began singing in church choirs and in high school formed the four b's a doo wop group that occasionally performed at the apollo
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1958 king still using his birth name joined a doo wop group called the five crowns
lines.name: English

lines.value: later that year the drifters manager george treadwell fired the members of the original drifters and replaced them with the members of the five crowns
lines.name: English

lines.value: king had a string of r&b hits with the group on atlantic records
lines.name: English

lines.value: he co wrote and sang lead on the first atlantic hit by the new version of the drifters there goes my baby 1959
lines.name: English

lines.value: he sang lead on a succession of hits by the team of doc pomus and mort shuman including save the last dance for me this magic moment and i count the tears
lines.name: English

lines.value: king recorded only thirteen songs with the drifters two backing other lead singers and eleven lead vocal performances including a non single called temptation later redone by drifters vocalist johnny moore
lines.name: English

lines.value: the last of the king led drifters singles to be released was sometimes i wonder which was recorded may 19 1960 but not issued until june 1962
lines.name: English

lines.value: due to contract disputes with treadwell in which king and his manager lover patterson demanded greater compensation king rarely performed with the drifters on tour or on television
lines.name: English

lines.value: on television fellow drifters member charlie thomas usually lip synched the songs that king had recorded with the drifters
lines.name: English

lines.value: in may 1960 king left the drifters assuming the stage name ben e king in preparation for a solo career
lines.name: English

lines.value: remaining with atlantic records on its atco imprint king scored his first solo hit with the ballad spanish harlem 1961
lines.name: English

lines.value: his next single stand by me written with jerry leiber and mike stoller ultimately would be voted as one of the songs of the century by the recording industry association of america
lines.name: English

lines.value: king cited singers brook benton roy hamilton and sam cooke as influences for his vocals of the song
lines.name: English

lines.value: stand by me there goes my baby spanish harlem and save the last dance for me were all named in the rock and roll hall of fame's 500 songs that shaped rock and roll and each of those records has earned a grammy hall of fame award
lines.name: English

lines.value: king's other well known songs include don't play that song you lied amor seven letters how can i forget on the horizon young boy blues first taste of love here comes the night ecstasy and that's when it hurts
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the summer of 1963 king had a top 30 hit with i who have nothing which reached the top 10 on new york's radio station wmca
lines.name: English

lines.value: king's records continued to place well on the billboard hot 100 chart until 1965
lines.name: English

lines.value: british pop bands began to dominate the pop music scene but king still continued to make r&b hits including what is soul 1966 tears tears tears 1967 and supernatural thing 1975
lines.name: English

lines.value: king returned to the drifters in late 1982 in england and sang with them until the group's break up and reorganization in 1986
lines.name: English

lines.value: from 1983 until the band's break up the other members of this incarnation of the drifters were johnny moore joe blunt and clyde brown
lines.name: English

lines.value: a 1986 reissue of stand by me followed the song's use as the theme song to the movie stand by me and reentered the billboard top ten after a 25-year absence
lines.name: English

lines.value: this reissue also reached number 1 in the united kingdom and ireland for three weeks in february 1987
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1990 king and bo diddley along with doug lazy recorded a revamped hip hop version of the monotones 1958 hit song book of love for the soundtrack of the movie book of love
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also recorded a children's album i have songs in my pocket written and produced by children's music artist bobby susser in 1998 which won the early childhood news directors choice award and dr toy's the institute for childhood resources award
lines.name: English

lines.value: king performed stand by me on the late show with david letterman in 2007
lines.name: English

lines.value: ahmet ertegun said king is one of the greatest singers in the history of rock and roll and rhythm and blues as a drifter and as a solo artist king had achieved five number one hits there goes my baby save the last dance for me stand by me supernatural thing and the 1986 reissue of stand by me
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also earned 12 top 10 hits and 26 top 40 hits from 1959 to 1986
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was inducted into the rock and roll hall of fame as a drifter he was also nominated as a solo artist
lines.name: English

lines.value: king's i who have nothing was selected for the sopranos peppers and eggs soundtrack cd 2001
lines.name: English

lines.value: king was inducted into the north carolina music hall of fame in 2009
lines.name: English

lines.value: on march 27 2012 the songwriters hall of fame announced that stand by me would receive its 2012 towering song award and that king would be honored with the 2012 towering performance award for his recording of the song
lines.name: English

lines.value: king was active in his charitable foundation the stand by me foundation which helps to provide education to deserving youths
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was a resident of teaneck new jersey from the late 1960s
lines.name: English

lines.value: king performed stand by me during a televised tribute to late comedian george carlin as he was one of carlin's favorite artists
lines.name: English

lines.value: on november 11 2010 he performed stand by me on the latin grammys with prince royce
lines.name: English

lines.value: king toured the united kingdom in 2013 and played concerts in the united states as late as 2014 despite reported health problems
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was announced on may 1 2015 that king had died at the hackensack university medical center on april 30 2015 at the age of 76
lines.name: English

lines.value: his agent said he had suffered from coronary problems at the time of his death
lines.name: English

lines.value: king was survived by his wife of 51 years betty three children and six grandchildren
lines.name: English

lines.value: on may 17 two weeks after his death imagine dragons performed stand by me at the 2015 billboard music awards as a tribute to his memory
lines.name: English

lines.value: king has been covered by acts from several genres

lines.value: the long toed stint calidris subminuta is a small wader
lines.name: English

lines.value: the genus name is from ancient greek kalidris or skalidris a term used by aristotle for some grey coloured waterside birds
lines.name: English

lines.value: the specific subminuta is from latin sub near to and minuta small from its similarity to the little stint calidris minuta
lines.name: English

lines.value: it breeds across northern asia and is strongly migratory wintering in south and south east asia and australasia
lines.name: English

lines.value: it occurs in western europe only as a very rare vagrant
lines.name: English

lines.value: this bird has yellowish legs and a short thin dark bill
lines.name: English

lines.value: breeding adults are a rich brown with darker feather centres above and white underneath
lines.name: English

lines.value: they have a light line above the eye and a brown crown
lines.name: English

lines.value: in winter long toed stints are grey above
lines.name: English

lines.value: the juveniles are brightly patterned above with rufous colouration and white mantle stripes
lines.name: English

lines.value: this bird can be difficult to distinguish from other similar tiny waders which are known collectively as peeps or stints
lines.name: English

lines.value: in particular long toed stint is very similar to its north american counterpart the least sandpiper
lines.name: English

lines.value: it differs from that species in its more slender longer necked appearance longer toes somewhat brighter colours and weaker wingbar
lines.name: English

lines.value: these birds forage on mudflats picking up food by sight sometimes by probing
lines.name: English

lines.value: they mainly eat small crustaceans insects and snails
lines.name: English

lines.value: little is known of the breeding habits of this species although it nests on the ground and the male has a display flight
lines.name: English

lines.value: the long toed stint is a very small wader measuring just in length with a wingspan of
lines.name: English

lines.value: it weighs about
lines.name: English

lines.value: it has a small head and short straight sharp tipped beak
lines.name: English

lines.value: the neck is slender,the belly rounded and the long legs are set well back
lines.name: English

lines.value: the toes are long and slender especially the middle one
lines.name: English

lines.value: the primary feathers extend as far as the tail
lines.name: English

lines.value: the crown is brown and there is a pale streak just above the eye
lines.name: English

lines.value: the upper parts are brown with the centres of the feathers darker brown
lines.name: English

lines.value: the breast is speckled with pale brown and the underparts are white
lines.name: English

lines.value: the legs and feet are yellow and the beak dark brown apart from the base of the lower mandible which is yellow or pale brown
lines.name: English

lines.value: this bird has a distinctive stance and its flight call distinguishes it from other sandpipers
lines.name: English

lines.value: on the ground it can be confused with the rednecked stint calidris ruficollis but is more finely built and slightly smaller
lines.name: English

lines.value: the long toed stint breeds in siberia during the northern hemisphere summer
lines.name: English

lines.value: little is known of its breeding habits but its breeding range includes the chukchi peninsula the koryak plateau the commander islands the kuril islands land bordering the sea of okhotsk north verkhoyansky district and around the ob river and the irtysh river
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the breeding season it migrates southwards passing through china indochina malaysia and the philippines and westwards to burma bangladesh nepal sri lanka and the maldive islands
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is a visitor to new guinea and australia and a vagrant to sweden south africa melanesia hawaii the northwestern usa and the vicinity of the bering sea
lines.name: English

lines.value: in its over wintering range it visits a variety of wetland habitats including shallow freshwater or brackish areas lakes swamps floodplains marshes lagoons muddy shores and sewage ponds
lines.name: English

lines.value: the long toed stint forages in wet habitats probing the ground with its beak
lines.name: English

lines.value: it feeds on molluscs crustaceans amphibians insects other invertebrates and seeds
lines.name: English

lines.value: it roosts in hollows in soft mud or in low vegetation bordering its feeding area
lines.name: English

lines.value: in its breeding range in russia its habitat is tundra taiga open grassy bogs or swamps
lines.name: English

lines.value: the nesting site tends to be in an area with mosses sedges and dwarf willows and is typically a well hidden shallow depression on a mound of sedge or dried grass
lines.name: English

lines.value: the long toed stint has a very wide range and it is estimated that there are somewhere between 10000 and 100000 individuals globally
lines.name: English

lines.value: there may be in the region of 25000 breeding pairs
lines.name: English

lines.value: the population trend is unknown but the iucn has listed the bird as being of least concern
lines.name: English

lines.value: no particular threats have been identified

lines.value: henri edmond cross born henri edmond joseph delacroix 20 may 1856 - 16 may 1910 was a french painter and printmaker
lines.name: English

lines.value: he is most acclaimed as a master of neo impressionism and he played an important role in shaping the second phase of that movement
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was a significant influence on henri matisse and many other artists
lines.name: English

lines.value: his work was instrumental in the development of fauvism
lines.name: English

lines.value: henri edmond joseph delacroix was born in douai a commune in the nord department in northern france on 20may 1856
lines.name: English

lines.value: he had no surviving siblings
lines.name: English

lines.value: his parents with a family history of ironmongery were alcide delacroix a french adventurer and british fanny woollett
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1865 the family moved to a location near lille a northern french city close to the belgian border
lines.name: English

lines.value: alcide's cousin dr.auguste soins recognized henri's artistic talent and was very supportive of his artistic inclinations even financing the boy's first drawing instructions under painter carolus duran the following year
lines.name: English

lines.value: henri was duran's protege for a year
lines.name: English

lines.value: his studies continued for a short time in paris in 1875 with francois bonvin before returning to lille
lines.name: English

lines.value: he studied at the ecole des beaux arts and in 1878 he enrolled at the ecoles academiques de dessin et d'architecture studying for three years in the studio of alphonse colas
lines.name: English

lines.value: his art education continued under fellow douai artist emile dupont zipcy after moving to paris in 1881
lines.name: English

lines.value: cross's early works portraits and still lifes were in the dark colors of realism
lines.name: English

lines.value: in order to distinguish himself from the famous romantic painter eugene delacroix he changed his name in 1881 shortening and anglicizing his birth name to henri cross - the french word croix means cross
lines.name: English

lines.value: 1881 was also the year of his first exhibition at the salon des artistes francais
lines.name: English

lines.value: he painted many landscapes on an 1883 trip to the alpes maritimes accompanied by his family
lines.name: English

lines.value: dr.soins who was also along on the trip was the subject of a painting that cross exhibited at nice's exposition universelle later in the year
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the mediterranean trip cross met paul signac who became a close friend and artistic influence
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1884 cross co founded the societe des artistes independants which consisted of artists displeased with the practices of the official salon and presented unjuried exhibitions without prizes
lines.name: English

lines.value: there he met and became friends with many artists involved in the neo impressionist movement including georges seurat albert dubois pillet and charles angrand
lines.name: English

lines.value: despite his association with the neo impressionists cross did not adopt their style for many years
lines.name: English

lines.value: his work continued to manifest influences such as jules bastien lepage and edouard manet as well as the impressionists
lines.name: English

lines.value: the change from his early somber realist work was gradual
lines.name: English

lines.value: his color palette became lighter working in the brighter colors of impressionism
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also worked en plein air
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the latter part of the 1880s he painted pure landscapes that showed the influence of claude monet and camille pissarro
lines.name: English

lines.value: in about 1886 again attempting to differentiate himself from another french artist - this time henri cros - he again changed his name finally adopting henri edmond cross
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1891 cross began painting in the neo impressionist style and exhibited his first large piece using this technique in an independants show
lines.name: English

lines.value: that painting was a divisionist portrait of madame hector france nee irma clare whom cross had met in 1888 and would marry in 1893
lines.name: English

lines.value: robert rosenblum wrote that the picture is softly charged with a granular atmospheric glow
lines.name: English

lines.value: cross had wintered in the south of france from 1883 onward until suffering from rheumatism he finally moved there full time in 1891
lines.name: English

lines.value: his works were still exhibited in paris
lines.name: English

lines.value: his first residence in southern france was in cabasson near le lavandou then he settled a short distance away in the small hamlet of saint clair where he spent the remainder of his life leaving only for trips to italy in 1903 and 1908 and for his annual independants exhibits in paris
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1892 cross's friend paul signac moved to nearby saint tropez where they frequently hosted gatherings in cross's garden attended by such luminaries as henri matisse andre derain and albert marquet
lines.name: English

lines.value: cross's affinity with the neo impressionist movement extended beyond the painting style to include their political philosophies
lines.name: English

lines.value: like signac pissarro and other neo impressionists cross believed in anarchist principles with hope for a utopian society
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1896 cross created a lithograph l'errant the wanderer
lines.name: English

lines.value: this marked the first time he had worked with a publisher and the piece was featured anonymously in les temps nouveaux jean grave's anarchist journal
lines.name: English

lines.value: cross's anarchist sentiments influenced his choice of subjects he painted scenes illustrating a utopian world that could exist through anarchism
lines.name: English

lines.value: the process of creating divisionist paintings with numerous small dots of color was tedious and time consuming
lines.name: English

lines.value: when cross wanted to depict quick impressions he created watercolor or colored pencil images in his sketchbooks
lines.name: English

lines.value: he wrote of a rustic french outing
lines.name: English

lines.value: cross's paintings of the early to mid 1890s are characteristically pointillist with closely and regularly positioned tiny dots of color
lines.name: English

lines.value: beginning around 1895 he gradually shifted his technique instead using broad blocky brushstrokes and leaving small areas of exposed bare canvas between the strokes
lines.name: English

lines.value: the resulting surfaces resembled mosaics and the paintings may be seen as precursors to fauvism and cubism
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the pointillist style minute spots of paint were used to blend colors harmoniously in contrast the strategy in second generation neo impressionism was to keep the colors separate resulting in vibrant shimmering visual effects through contrast
lines.name: English

lines.value: cross stated that the neo impressionists were far more interested in creating harmonies of pure color than in harmonizing the colors of a particular landscape or natural scene
lines.name: English

lines.value: matisse and other artists were very influenced by the late career cross and such works were instrumental in forming the principles of fauvism
lines.name: English

lines.value: among the other artists influenced by cross were andre derain henri manguin charles camoin albert marquet jean puy and louis valtat
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1905 galerie druet in paris mounted cross's first solo exhibition which featured thirty paintings and thirty watercolors
lines.name: English

lines.value: the show was very successful receiving critical acclaim and most of the works were sold
lines.name: English

lines.value: belgian symbolist poet emile verhaeren an avid supporter of neo impressionism in his country provided the preface for the exhibition catalog writing in the early 1880s cross began to experience trouble with his eyes which grew more severe in the 1900s
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also increasingly suffered from arthritis
lines.name: English

lines.value: at least in part due to these health issues that plagued him for years cross's body of work is relatively small
lines.name: English

lines.value: however in his last years he was productive and very creative and his work was featured in significant solo exhibitions he received great acclaim from critics and enjoyed commercial success
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1909 cross was treated in a paris hospital for cancer
lines.name: English

lines.value: in january 1910 he returned to saint clair where he died of the cancer just four days short of his 54th birthday on 16may 1910
lines.name: English

lines.value: his tomb in the le lavandou cemetery features a bronze medallion that his friend theo van rysselberghe had designed
lines.name: English

lines.value: in july 1911 the city of cross's birth douai mounted a retrospective exhibition of his work
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition to the exhibitions mentioned above cross participated in many others
lines.name: English

lines.value: octave maus invited him to exhibit his work in several of the annual exhibitions of lesxx
lines.name: English

lines.value: cross participated in the libre esthetique show of 1895 at maus's invitation and also in those of 1897 1901 1904 1908 and 1909
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1898 he participated with paul signac maximilien luce and theo van rysselberghe in the first neo impressionist exhibition in germany organized by harry kessler at keller und reiner gallery berlin
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1907 felix feneon assembled a cross retrospective in paris at galerie bernheim jeune with maurice denis contributing the catalogue preface
lines.name: English

lines.value: other venues with cross exhibitions included samuel bing's l'art nouveau a paris galerie durand ruel paris cassirer gallery hamburg berlin toison d'or exhibition moscow bernheim jeune's aquarelle et pastel and various others including galleries in paris dresden weimar and munich
lines.name: English

lines.value: uss robert e lee ssbn-601 a fleet ballistic missile submarine was the only ship of the united states navy to be named for robert e lee 1807-1870 the commanding general of the confederate forces during the american civil war
lines.name: English

lines.value: her keel was laid down on 25 august 1958 by the newport news shipbuilding & dry dock company of newport news virginia
lines.name: English

lines.value: she was launched on 18 december 1959 sponsored by mrs anne carter ely nee lee widow of hanson edward ely jr and granddaughter of the ship's namesake and commissioned on 16 september 1960 with commander reuben f woodal commanding the blue crew and commander joseph williams jr commanding the gold crew
lines.name: English

lines.value: the third nuclear powered ballistic missile submarine to join the fleet and the first nuclear powered submarine built in the southern united states robert e lee operated in and out of newport news virginia until 2 december 1960 when she got underway for the narragansett bay operating area for torpedo firing tests
lines.name: English

lines.value: following the successful firing of five torpedoes on 6 december 1960 robert e lee departed for cape kennedy florida arriving on 12 december 1960
lines.name: English

lines.value: she then loaded polaris test missiles and on 22 december 1960 conducted her first missile launch
lines.name: English

lines.value: the polaris flew hot and true in january 1961 robert e lee conducted additional simulated missile launches and on 15 january 1961 departed for the bermuda operating area
lines.name: English

lines.value: there joined by the submarine on 25 january 1961 she engaged in antisubmarine warfare training with torsk
lines.name: English

lines.value: returning to norfolk on 30 january robert e lee entered the newport news drydock on 3 february for a month of shipyard work
lines.name: English

lines.value: she departed newport news on 17 march 1961 loaded torpedoes at yorktown virginia on 25 march and got underway for cape kennedy arriving on 9 april 1961
lines.name: English

lines.value: robert e lee conducted special operations out of cape kennedy during may and june 1961 and in late june departed for holy loch scotland where she joined submarine squadron 14 on 10 july 1961
lines.name: English

lines.value: she conducted practice torpedo firing during the first week of august and departed holy loch on 9 august 1961 on her first deterrent patrol
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the next two years she completed nine more deterrent patrols
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 10 september 1963 robert e lee entered the floating drydock then on 4 october 1963 resumed her normal patrol schedule
lines.name: English

lines.value: continuing to operate out of holy loch into 1964 she got underway on 27 november 1964 for her 16th patrol which terminated on 28 january 1965 at mare island naval shipyard vallejo california
lines.name: English

lines.value: punxsutawney phil is the name of a groundhog in punxsutawney pennsylvania
lines.name: English

lines.value: on february 2 groundhog day each year the town of punxsutawney celebrates the legendary groundhog with a festive atmosphere of music and food
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the ceremony which begins well before the winter sunrise phil emerges from his temporary home on gobbler's knob located in a rural area about 2 miles 3 km south east of town
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to the tradition if phil sees his shadow and returns to his hole he has predicted six more weeks of winter like weather
lines.name: English

lines.value: if phil does not see his shadow he has predicted an early spring the date of phil's prognostication is known as groundhog day in the united states and canada and has been celebrated since 1887
lines.name: English

lines.value: punxsutawney phil became an international celebrity thanks to the 1993 movie groundhog day
lines.name: English

lines.value: a select group called the punxsutawney groundhog club inner circle takes care of phil year round and also plans the annual ceremony
lines.name: English

lines.value: members of the inner circle are recognizable by their top hats and tuxedos
lines.name: English

lines.value: the vice president of the inner circle prepares two scrolls in advance of the actual ceremony one proclaiming six more weeks of winter and one proclaiming an early spring
lines.name: English

lines.value: at day break on february 2 punxsutawney phil awakens from his burrow on gobbler's knob is helped to the top of the stump by his handlers and explains to the president of the inner circle in a language known as groundhogese whether or not he has seen his shadow
lines.name: English

lines.value: the president of the inner circle the only person able to understand groundhogese through his possession of an ancient acacia wood cane then interprets phil's message and directs the vice president to read the proper scroll to the anxiously anticipating crowd gathered on gobbler's knob and the masses of phaithful phollowers tuned in to live broadcasts around the world
lines.name: English

lines.value: the inner circle scripts the groundhog day ceremonies in advance with the decision on whether or not phil will see his shadow made beforehand
lines.name: English

lines.value: the inner circle maintains kayfabe throughout the year never acknowledging the ruse and its criteria for whether or not spring will arrive early is a trade secret
lines.name: English

lines.value: the stormfax almanac has made note of the weather conditions on each groundhog day since 1999 the almanac has recorded 12 incidents in a 20-year span in which the groundhog was claimed to have seen his shadow while the sky was cloudy or there was rain or snow coming down and one case in which the groundhog did not see his shadow despite sunshine
lines.name: English

lines.value: the practices and lore of punxsutawney phil's predictions are predicated on a light hearted suspension of disbelief by those involved
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to the lore there is only one phil and all other groundhogs are impostors
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is claimed that this one groundhog has lived to make weather prognostications since 1886 sustained by drinks of groundhog punch or elixir of life administered at the annual groundhog picnic in the fall
lines.name: English

lines.value: in this respect punxsutawney phil is unique the lifespan of a groundhog in the wild is roughly six years
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to the groundhog club phil after the prediction speaks to the club president in groundhogese which only the current president can understand and then his prediction is translated for the entire world
lines.name: English

lines.value: the groundhog day celebration is rooted in a celtic and germanic tradition that says that if a hibernating animal casts a shadow on february 2 the pagan holiday of imbolc known among christians as candlemas winter and cold weather will last another six weeks
lines.name: English

lines.value: if no shadow is seen legend says spring will come early
lines.name: English

lines.value: in germany the tradition evolved into a myth that if the sun came out on candlemas a hedgehog would cast its shadow predicting snow all the way into may
lines.name: English

lines.value: when german immigrants settled in pennsylvania they transferred the tradition onto local fauna replacing hedgehogs with groundhogs
lines.name: English

lines.value: each year two scrolls are prepared by the vice president of the inner circle one says early spring and one says six more weeks of winter
lines.name: English

lines.value: these scrolls are placed during the ceremony on the stump and after phil is awoken by the crowd phil communicates in groundhogese to the president who is then directed by phil to the proper scroll and forecast

lines.value: as of 2018 punxsutawney phil has made 132 predictions with an early spring no shadow predicted 18 times 13.63%

lines.value: oml outline markup language is an xml format for outlines
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was originally proposed by ray grieselhuber
lines.name: English

lines.value: the specification is designed to build upon the concepts found in opml with the goal of fixing some of its limitations
lines.name: English

lines.value: oml has a structure similar to opml
lines.name: English

lines.value: its advocates claim that although it is as simple and as flexible as opml its extension mechanism is better than that of opml
lines.name: English

lines.value: instead of letting users add attributes freely oml introduces an element child element of ); instances of the element may be added freely
lines.name: English

lines.value: the resulting documents are claimed to be easier to parse than equivalent opml documents
lines.name: English

lines.value: readers of opml never know what attributes others may have added to standard elements so an element the reader wants to parse may contain a mixture of known and unknown attributes
lines.name: English

lines.value: this claimed disadvantage of opml actually applies to any xml based format including oml because xml namespaces may add attributes to existing tags however opml is unusual in its enthusiasm for free form definition of new attributes
lines.name: English

lines.value: in oml extensions are added in the form of s instead an unknown may be discarded without harming known data elsewhere in the file
lines.name: English

lines.value: the approach taken by oml is designed to be more in keeping with the approach of other xml based languages and with the philosophy of some standards organizations
lines.name: English

lines.value: despite its claimed advantages oml has not seen wide use
lines.name: English

lines.value: reasons for the greater popularity of opml may include the relative newness of oml finalized in may 2003 and non technical political issues between members of the xml community
lines.name: English

lines.value: critics of oml point out oml doesn't have a mechanism to preserve whitespace
lines.name: English

lines.value: some have also found the distinction between and <data> unnecessary

lines.value: for example poke in the eye does only one point of direct damage but also renders the target unable to defend against a follow up attack from the same player who used poke in the eye and either leaves the target defenseless against an attack from the next player to take a turn or if the next player is the victim makes the victim lose a turn
lines.name: English

lines.value: special attacks can be countered by playing block dodge or in the case of grab which does no initial damage but sets up the victim for other attacks like headlock and choke freedom
lines.name: English

lines.value: weapons like basic attacks do simple damage always three points without additional harmful effects to the target but unlike all other cards they are not discarded when played
lines.name: English

lines.value: a player can thus use the hammer for example repeatedly over the course of many turns
lines.name: English

lines.value: weapon attacks may be countered with block or dodge
lines.name: English

lines.value: they can also be countered by the otherwise useless disarm which forces the attacker to discard the weapon
lines.name: English

lines.value: persons playing disarm are not allowed to capture the weapon for their own use
lines.name: English

lines.value: defense cards either negate attacks allowing the target to avoid taking damage or repair damage already taken
lines.name: English

lines.value: dodge may be used against any attack card block against any attack other than grab
lines.name: English

lines.value: freedom is useful only against grab attacks and may also be used to escape from special attacks that do ongoing damage such as headlock
lines.name: English

lines.value: first aid heals two points of damage when played
lines.name: English

lines.value: any number of first aid cards may be played at the same time either on a player's turn or as a last ditch defense if a player takes enough damage from an attack that he or she would otherwise be out of the game
lines.name: English

lines.value: humiliation the trump card of the game is usually used as a defense since it immediately cancels the effect of any single card
lines.name: English

lines.value: however since it can be played at any time and for any reason without the player needing to wait for his or her turn it can also be used offensively to for example cancel another player's successful dodge or use of first aid
lines.name: English

lines.value: humiliation cannot be countered except with the use of another humiliation
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to the game directions humiliation when played should always be accompanied by a detailed description of what has been done to thoroughly humiliate the victim
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is an example of the way the game encourages boasting and trash talking as part of the fun

lines.value: the aspen music festival and school is a classical music festival held annually in aspen colorado
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is noted both for its concert programming and its musical training of mostly young adult music students
lines.name: English

lines.value: founded in 1949 the typical eight week summer season includes more than 400 classical music events -including concerts by five orchestras solo and chamber music performances fully staged opera productions master classes lectures and children's programming and brings in 70000 audience members
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the winter the amfs presents a small series of recitals and metropolitan opera live in hd screenings
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a training ground for young adult classical musicians the amfs draws more than 600 students from 40-plus countries with an average age of 23
lines.name: English

lines.value: while in aspen students participate in lessons coaching and public performances in orchestras operas and chamber music sometimes playing side by side with amfs artist faculty
lines.name: English

lines.value: the organization is currently led by president and ceo alan fletcher and music director robert spano
lines.name: English

lines.value: the aspen music festival and school was founded in 1949 by chicago businessman walter paepcke and elizabeth paepcke as a two week bicentennial celebration of the 18th-century german writer johann wolgang von goethe
lines.name: English

lines.value: the event which included both intellectual forums and musical performances was such a success that it led to the formation of both the aspen institute and the aspen music festival and school
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the summers that followed the participating musicians returned bringing their music students and the foundation was set for the amfs as it is known today
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1951 the school enrolled its first official class with 183 music students
lines.name: English

lines.value: that same year igor stravinsky became the first conductor to present his own works with the festival
lines.name: English

lines.value: early founding musicians included baritone mack harrell father of cellist lynn harrell and violinist roman totenberg father of npr legal correspondent nina totenberg
lines.name: English

lines.value: early performance highlights include then student james levine conducted the benjamin britten opera albert herring in 1964 coinciding with britten's visit to aspen that summer to accept an award from the aspen institute
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1965 duke ellington and his orchestra came to the amfs to perform a benefit concert
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1971 dorothy delay joined the amfs strings artist faculty and attracted more than 200 students a summer to her program
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1975 aaron copland came to aspen as a composer in residence on the occasion of his 75th birthday
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1980 john denver performed with the aspen festival orchestra for his tv special music and the mountains which aired the following year on abc
lines.name: English

lines.value: multiple artist faculty members have also recorded albums while in aspen including the emerson string quartet which recorded the shostakovich the string quartets 5-disc set from amfs venue harris concert hall and won the 2000 grammy award for best classical album
lines.name: English

lines.value: the aspen music festival and school offers young musicians a choice of twelve programs of study orchestra brass quintet studies the finckel wu han chamber music studio solo piano collaborative piano opera coaching the aspen opera theater center the american academy of conducting at aspen the susan and ford schumann center for composition studies the aspen contemporary ensemble the center for advanced quartet studies and classical guitar
lines.name: English

lines.value: the benedict music tent which opened in 2000 is the festival's primary concert venue and seats 2050
lines.name: English

lines.value: the tent replaced an earlier tent designed by herbert bayer which in 1965 replaced the original smaller tent designed by eero saarinen
lines.name: English

lines.value: concerts are held in the benedict music tent on a nearly daily basis during the summer and seating on the lawn just outside the tent where many choose to picnic during events is always free

lines.value: the design has open sides the curving roof is made of teflon coated fiberglass a hard material also used by the denver international airport

lines.value: the 500-seat joan and irving harris concert hall is located next door to the benedict music tent and was opened in 1993 at a cost of $7 million

lines.value: in 2016 the amfs completed its $75 million 105000-square-foot matthew and carolyn bucksbaum campus which serves as the center of its teaching activities

lines.value: the deep is also a landmark centre for marine research

lines.value: in 2013 the aquarium was voted the best family place to visit in hull.[9] the deep is a charitable public aquarium dedicated to increasing people's enjoyment and understanding of the world's oceans

lines.value: walter ernest brown 3 july 1885 - 28 february 1942 was an australian recipient of the victoria cross the highest award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to members of the british and commonwealth forces
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was born in tasmania and worked as a grocer before enlisting in the australian army in 1915 following the outbreak of first world war
lines.name: English

lines.value: initially he was sent to egypt where he served in the australian service corps before being transferred to the western front where he served in the infantry with the 20th battalion
lines.name: English

lines.value: in july 1918 during the fighting at villers bretonneux he single handedly destroyed a german machine gun post taking a number of prisoners in the process
lines.name: English

lines.value: for this act he was awarded the victoria cross
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was also later awarded the distinguished conduct medal for a previous act of bravery
lines.name: English

lines.value: following the war brown was repatriated to australia and returned to civilian life
lines.name: English

lines.value: when the second world war began he lied about his age and previous experience in order to reenlist in the australian army this time serving in the royal australian artillery
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1942 brown's unit was sent to singapore following the japanese attack on malaya
lines.name: English

lines.value: he is believed to have been killed in action on 28 february 1942 although his body has never been recovered
lines.name: English

lines.value: walter ernest brown was born on 3 july 1885 in new norfolk tasmania
lines.name: English

lines.value: his parents were sidney francis brown a miller and agnes mary brown nee carney
lines.name: English

lines.value: after finishing his schooling he worked as a grocer in hobart until 1911 when he moved to petersham new south wales where he remained in the same line of work until the first world war broke out
lines.name: English

lines.value: brown enlisted in the australian imperial force in july 1915 and was initially assigned to the 1st australian light horse regiment before being transferred to the imperial camel corps in egypt
lines.name: English

lines.value: after being transferred to france he was assigned to the 55th battalion australian infantry 1st and 2nd field butcheries australian service corps and then finally the 20th battalion 5th brigade 2nd division
lines.name: English

lines.value: he managed to secure his transfer to the infantry by claiming that he had lost his false teeth which meant that he had to be removed from the theatre and returned to egypt where he was able to attach himself to the infantry reinforcements that were being concentrated there prior to being sent to france to join the 20th battalion
lines.name: English

lines.value: his transfer to the 20th battalion took place in july 1917 and he joined them while they were stationed in the line around st omer
lines.name: English

lines.value: during september and october 1917 brown took part in the fighting around passchendaele and it was for his actions during this time that he was later awarded the distinguished conduct medal
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 19 october he was promoted to lance corporal
lines.name: English

lines.value: in november he was wounded however he returned to his unit shortly after and on 7 april 1918 he was promoted to the rank of corporal
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 6 july 1918 at villers bretonneux france he performed the deed for which he was awarded the victoria cross brown had rushed a machine gun post armed with a hand grenade taking one officer and 11 men prisoner under heavy machine gun fire
lines.name: English

lines.value: after this incident brown remained at the front until the end of the war and despite being wounded again in august he was promoted to sergeant on 13 september 1918
lines.name: English

lines.value: following the war he was repatriated to australia in late 1919 before being discharged on medical grounds in february 1920
lines.name: English

lines.value: the award of the victoria cross to brown was published in a supplement to the london gazette on 17 august 1918 reading
lines.name: English

lines.value: after being discharged from the aif in early 1920 brown went to live in sydney
lines.name: English

lines.value: during this time he undertook a number of different lines of work being employed as a brass finisher up until 1930 when he moved to leeton and taking up a position as a water bailiff in the new south wales water conservation and irrigation commission
lines.name: English

lines.value: he remained in this job until he rejoined the army in 1940
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 4 june 1932 brown married maude dillon at christ church in bexley
lines.name: English

lines.value: the couple had two children a boy and a girl
lines.name: English

lines.value: following the outbreak of the second world war brown enlisted as a gunner under his real name in the 2/15th field regiment royal australian artillery in june 1940
lines.name: English

lines.value: hoping to avoid attention and wanting to secure a posting to the front lines he declared that he had no previous military experience and also claimed he had been born in 1900 in order to meet the age requirements for front line service
lines.name: English

lines.value: although his identity became public knowledge the military authorities allowed him to continue serving
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was briefly promoted to lance sergeant but requested to revert to the rank of gunner
lines.name: English

lines.value: his unit was sent to malaya in august 1941 where they were attached to the 27th brigade and then to singapore in february 1942 when it was invaded
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 15 february 1942 brown's regiment moved up to the front line to make a final stand
lines.name: English

lines.value: sources disagree as to what happened to brown after this
lines.name: English

lines.value: when the order to surrender came some witnesses alleged him to have calmly picked up some grenades and said no surrender for me before walking towards the enemy lines never to be seen again
lines.name: English

lines.value: author john moremon however believes that brown sought to escape and after gaining permission from his commanding officer led a group of 2/15th men to rengat in sumatra in a rowing boat
lines.name: English

lines.value: from there it is believed that brown and the others attempted to link up with other troops that were being evacuated via bus but they became separated and although some managed to get away to padang brown is believed to have been killed while waiting for transport
lines.name: English

lines.value: although his date of death is uncertain it has been presumed that brown was killed some time after he went missing and the commonwealth war graves commission officially records his date of death as 28 february 1942
lines.name: English

lines.value: as his body was never found brown has no known grave although he is commemorated at the singapore memorial at kranji war cemetery in singapore
lines.name: English

lines.value: his victoria cross is displayed at the australian war memorial in canberra

lines.value: the armet is a type of helmet which was developed in the 15th century
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was extensively used in italy france england the low countries and spain
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was distinguished by being the first helmet of its era to completely enclose the head while being compact and light enough to move with the wearer
lines.name: English

lines.value: its use was essentially restricted to the fully armoured man at arms
lines.name: English

lines.value: as the armet was fully enclosing and narrowed to follow the contours of the neck and throat it had to have a mechanical means of opening and closing to enable it to be worn
lines.name: English

lines.value: the typical armet consisted of four pieces the skull the two large hinged cheek pieces which locked at the front over the chin and a visor which had a double pivot one either side of the skull
lines.name: English

lines.value: the cheek pieces opened laterally when closed they overlapped at the chin fastening by means of a spring pin which engaged in a corresponding hole or by a swivel hook and pierced staple
lines.name: English

lines.value: a multi part reinforcement for the bottom half of the face known as a wrapper was sometimes added its straps were protected by a metal disc at the base of the skull piece called a rondel
lines.name: English

lines.value: the visor attached to each pivot via hinges with removable pins as in the later examples of the bascinet
lines.name: English

lines.value: this method remained in use until c 1520 after which the hinge disappeared and the visor had a solid connection to its pivot
lines.name: English

lines.value: the earlier armet often had a small aventail a piece of mail attached to the bottom edge of each cheek piece
lines.name: English

lines.value: the earliest surviving armet dates to 1420 and was made in milan
lines.name: English

lines.value: an italian origin for this type of helmet therefore seems to be indicated
lines.name: English

lines.value: the innovation of a reduced skull and large hinged cheek pieces was such a radical departure from previous forms of helmet that it is highly probable that the armet resulted from the invention of a single armourer or soldier and not as the result of evolution from earlier forms
lines.name: English

lines.value: the armet reached the height of its popularity during the late 15th and early 16th centuries when western european full plate armour had been perfected
lines.name: English

lines.value: movable face and cheek pieces allowed the wearer to close the helmet thus fully protecting the head from blows
lines.name: English

lines.value: the term armet was often applied in contemporary usage to any fully enclosing helmet however modern scholarship draws a distinction between the armet and the outwardly similar close helm on the basis of their construction especially their means of opening to allow them to be worn
lines.name: English

lines.value: while an armet had two large cheekpieces hinged at the skull and opened laterally a close helm instead had a kind of movable bevor which was attached to the same pivot points as its visor and opened vertically
lines.name: English

lines.value: the classic armet had a narrow extension to the back of the skull reaching down to the nape of the neck and the cheekpieces were hinged horizontally directly from the main part of the skull
lines.name: English

lines.value: from about 1515 the germans produced a variant armet where the downward extension of the skull was made much wider reaching as far forward as the ears
lines.name: English

lines.value: the cheekpieces on this type of helmet hinged vertically on the edges of this wider neck element
lines.name: English

lines.value: the high quality english greenwich armours often included this type of armet from c 1525
lines.name: English

lines.value: greenwich made armets adopted the elegant two piece visor found on contemporary close helmets armets of this form were manufactured until as late as 1615
lines.name: English

lines.value: the lower edge of such helmets often closed over a flange in the upper edge of a gorget piece
lines.name: English

lines.value: the helmet could then rotate without allowing a gap in the armour that a weapon point could enter
