lines.value: as the record industry began evolving due to the widespread use of the internet and the increasing ease with which artists can record at home zomba made moves that illustrated their desire to change with the times
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2000 they joined the growing list of record companies that made some music available via digital download with online distribution company amplified entertainment
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2002 zomba joined majors emi universal and bmg with approving some of their jive catalog for release on the new dataplay media
lines.name: English

lines.value: though the media was largely unsuccessful the move illustrated zomba's competitiveness with the major labels in the growing digital world
lines.name: English

lines.value: however a negative outcome of the changing times was the closing of some of zomba's battery studios and dreamline equipment rental businesses towards the end of 2001
lines.name: English

lines.value: around 1993 clive calder began his uneasy relationship with lou pearlman
lines.name: English

lines.value: pearlman had put together a new group backstreet boys which was languishing on mercury without any hits
lines.name: English

lines.value: he presented the group to calder along with david mcpherson
lines.name: English

lines.value: though initially uninterested due to the dominance of grunge and alternative rock calder thought that the group could help expand his operations overseas
lines.name: English

lines.value: zomba bought out the boys contract for $35000 and moved the group over to zomba imprint jive
lines.name: English

lines.value: calder immediately sent the group to sweden and matched them with a group of producers recently found by zomba scouts dag volle and martin sandberg
lines.name: English

lines.value: in mid 1995 the band recorded their three songs including their first single at cheiron studios in stockholm
lines.name: English

lines.value: next calder matched them with an old friend stuart watson who ran swat enterprises a company specializing in promotion in asia
lines.name: English

lines.value: the group went to asia began touring relentlessly and released their first album which sold one million copies in three weeks
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1997 when calder thought the grunge phenomenon had sufficiently passed he took the group back over to the united states where their north american debut ended up selling upwards of 14 million copies creating the first in a run of many hits that zomba and the backstreet boys would enjoy together
lines.name: English

lines.value: while pearlman and watson were breaking the backstreet boys overseas jive a&r man steve lunt was busy in the us seeking a female star and was greeted with fifteen year old britney spears
lines.name: English

lines.value: initially horrified by spears karaoke demo of a toni braxton song sung in the wrong register lunt was intrigued by a brief moment at the end where he heard the kind of soul she had as was the virtually the standard at zomba lunt took spears to in house songwriter and producer eric foster white in the company's publishing division and the two recorded you got it all like the backstreet boys spears was hooked up with cheiron producer max martin
lines.name: English

lines.value: within thirty days of letting a music director at star 100.7 in san diego hear ...baby one more time the song was number one on the charts in 1999
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1999 zomba was involved in a boy band controversy when trying to sign another group that pearlman had put together himself *nsync
lines.name: English

lines.value: *nsync had recently left rca due to allegations that pearlman had taken approximately 50% of their profits and not the one sixth that he had agreed to
lines.name: English

lines.value: seeing the group as a free agent jive quickly signed them and prepared to release their next album
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 12 october pearlman's company trans continental in conjunction with rca owner bmg entertainment and bmg ariola munich sued jive records clive calder and the members of *nsync for $150 million citing among other things breach of contract
lines.name: English

lines.value: pearlman sought an injunction against the release of the band's new album and that the recordings be given to him but it was denied in court
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a response to the suit and in reference to treatment by trans continental *nsync released a statement citing the company's poor conduct as the most glaring overt and callous example of artist exploitation that the music industry has seen in a long time the lawsuit was settled on 23 december with undisclosed terms but left jive free to release future *nsync albums
lines.name: English

lines.value: the lawsuit which rolling stone called the music industry's nastiest legal skirmishes in years was problematic for zomba for two main reasons
lines.name: English

lines.value: first having heard that n sync was signed to jive the backstreet boys did not want to be a part of the label anymore
lines.name: English

lines.value: second the lawsuit temporarily strained zomba's relationship with bmg whose distribution deal with zomba was coming to a close
lines.name: English

lines.value: jive initially announced that they would not renew their deal with bmg but reconsidered following the lawsuit with bmg and trans continental
lines.name: English

lines.value: the distribution deal may have been a determining factor in the outcome of the lawsuit since distributed zomba product accounted for 5.5% of bmg's us market share and company ceo strauss zelnick was under pressure not to lose that
lines.name: English

lines.value: they also signed a new deal with the backstreet boys that gave the band a 20% royalty rate
lines.name: English

lines.value: bmg had owned 25% of zomba's publishing business since 1991 and 20% of its recording business since 1996
lines.name: English

lines.value: as part of bmg's 1996 agreement with zomba the music giant was required to follow through on a put option and buy the remaining shares it did not already own before 31 december 2002
lines.name: English

lines.value: in june 2002 clive calder decided to exercise the put option
lines.name: English

lines.value: effective 26 november 2002 bmg entertainment concluded its deal with zomba for the purchase of the company's entire assets
lines.name: English

lines.value: while calder had originally requested $3.2 billion for his shares in zomba valuation of the label's assets varied from $1.6 billion to $2.4 billion
lines.name: English

lines.value: following the purchase negotiations a price of $2.74 billion was agreed upon the biggest purchase of an independent at the time
lines.name: English

lines.value: zomba's sale had been the latest in a series of independent label sellouts including island records and geffen records both sold to universal for $300 million and $550 million respectively and virgin sold for $950 million to emi
lines.name: English

lines.value: the $2.74 billion paid for the zomba group was more than was paid for the purchase of many others labels including island geffen virgin a&m motown chrysalis and def jam combined
lines.name: English

lines.value: initially bmg took its time in integrating zomba with the rest of its labels hoping that the former independent would lift bmgs worldwide rank from fifth to fourth largest record company
lines.name: English

lines.value: calder resigned his position as ceo immediately after the purchase but stayed on in an advisory position for about another year
lines.name: English

lines.value: in mid 2003 bmg began its worldwide integration of zomba cutting hundreds of jobs through the consolidation of regional operations
lines.name: English

lines.value: while many of the key managers stayed and the large offices in the us and the uk remained operational all of the other regional offices were assimilated into bmg
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition to the regional mergers the zomba and bmg publishing companies were integrated
lines.name: English

lines.value: the us and uk offices remained as stand alone units but many of the back office functions were consolidated into bmg
lines.name: English

lines.value: the provident music group zomba's foray into the christian music market was reassigned as a rca sub label
lines.name: English

lines.value: by 2004 the record labels were reorganized under the zomba label group
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2004 bmg and sony music entertainment merged to form sony bmg music entertainment taking zomba with it
lines.name: English

lines.value: though the merger was plagued with controversy and eventually ended with sony buying out bmg's stake in late 2008 zomba executives continued to expand the company's operations in various aspects
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2007 as part of sony bmg integration and consolidation rca music group and zomba label group merged their international sales and field staffs to form the bmg label group under sony bmg
lines.name: English

lines.value: rca and zomba kept separate groups under bmg but this configuration was short lived due to the dissolution of the sony bmg merger
lines.name: English

lines.value: zomba is currently owned wholly by and operates under sony
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 2 november 2004 the american federation of musicians announced that it had entered into an agreement with zomba
lines.name: English

lines.value: effective 1 january 2005 the labor union covered all artists on any zomba subsidiary labels and any future labels under the federation's sound recording labor agreement
lines.name: English

lines.value: the deal ensured that all artists under the zomba aegis would receive for the first time a full range of benefits and protections among which are scale payments industry standard working conditions and pension contributions
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2005 zomba formed zomba gospel under the zomba label group in an effort to collate its recently expanding gospel labels
lines.name: English

lines.value: zomba's interest in gospel began in the form of a distribution deal with gospocentric records and sublabel b'rite music in october 2001 which zomba later purchased in 2004
lines.name: English

lines.value: verity records president max siegel was charged with heading the new entity which included zomba labels verity and gospocentric as well as four artist owned imprints quiet water entertainment donald lawrence fo yo soul entertainment kirk franklin new life records john p kee and f hammond music fred hammond
lines.name: English

lines.value: distribution was handled by provident integrity for the christian bookselling association and through sony distribution formerly sony bmg for the mainstream market
lines.name: English

lines.value: zomba's publishing division also continued its expansion
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2006 zomba music publishing purchased the catalogue of the uk based strongsongs music publishing from the telstar music group
lines.name: English

lines.value: this large acquisition gave expanded zomba's rights to many international hitmakers to include metallica craig david and dannii minogue among others
lines.name: English

lines.value: beginning with the appointment of david mantel in 2005 as the head of zomba music publishing us operations the company began to take a different signing approach that focused on unknown or unsigned artists
lines.name: English

lines.value: mantel's first signing was t pain whose two singles i'm sprung and i'm n luv wit a stripper hit number 8 and 5 respectively on the billboard hot 100
lines.name: English

lines.value: this type of signing was also used in the records division were artists or producers were given their own imprint
lines.name: English

lines.value: in october 2008 zomba made an all inclusive multiyear joint venture deal with hitz committee entertainment and imprint in the making for almost 5 years by jive a&r vp micky memphitz wright
lines.name: English

lines.value: beginning in 2008 hitz committee consists of a record label under sony music production music publishing artist and producer management and tv and film projects
lines.name: English

lines.name: English

lines.value: the quintet pooled their cash and recorded three songs at fat cat studios in sacramento california

lines.name: English

lines.name: English

lines.value: upon hearing the songs reines invited the band to play a showcase in los angeles for him and drive thru co owner stefanie reines
lines.name: English

lines.value: that same night over dinner the two offered the band a record deal
lines.name: English

lines.value: on november 6 2004 self against city officially became the first band to sign to rushmore records only a few months after their formation
lines.name: English

lines.value: their first act as a signed band was to record a cover of darlene love's alone on christmas for the drive thru christmas compilation happy holidays from drive thru records and a sixth song for their debut ep advance copies of which had been given out at a show at the boardwalk in orangevale california on october 28 2004

lines.value: upon returning home in july latour left the band

lines.value: though initially the band made efforts to replace latour &mdash blake abbey of the daytona beach florida band abagnale sporadically filled in as a rhythm guitarist &mdash they soon decided to continue on as a four piece and began writing songs for their first full length record

lines.value: cartwright is a community located on the eastern side of the entrance to sandwich bay along the southern coast of labrador in the province of newfoundland and labrador canada
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was incorporated in 1956
lines.name: English

lines.value: cartwright has been a settled community since 1775 when captain george cartwright for whom the place is named settled there establishing a fish and fur trading business
lines.name: English

lines.value: eleven years later he left labrador maintaining a business interest there until it was sold to hunt and henley in 1815
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was again sold in 1873 to the hudson's bay company and has remained under company ownership ever since
lines.name: English

lines.value: since 2002 cartwright has been connected by road a section of the trans labrador highway with blanc sablon quebec where there is a car ferry to newfoundland
lines.name: English

lines.value: since december 2009 the remaining link between cartwright and goose bay labrador has been completed and open to the public
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the 2011 census the population was 516 down 6.5% from 552 in the 2006 census
lines.name: English

lines.value: cartwright has a subarctic climate dfc with very snowy winters and short mild summers
lines.name: English

lines.value: job satisfaction or employee satisfaction is how content an individual is with her or his job whether or not they like the job or individual aspects or facets of jobs such as nature of work or supervision
lines.name: English

lines.value: job satisfaction can be measured in cognitive evaluative affective or emotional and behavioral components
lines.name: English

lines.value: researchers have also noted that job satisfaction measures vary in the extent to which they measure feelings about the job affective job satisfaction
lines.name: English

lines.value: or cognitions about the job cognitive job satisfaction
lines.name: English

lines.value: one of the most widely used definitions in organizational research is that of locke 1976 who defines job satisfaction as a pleasurable or positive emotional state resulting from the appraisal of one's job or job experiences p
lines.name: English

lines.value: others have defined it as simply how content an individual is with his or her job whether he or she likes the job or not
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is assessed at both the global level whether or not the individual is satisfied with the job overall or at the facet level whether or not the individual is satisfied with different aspects of the job
lines.name: English

lines.value: spector 1997 lists 14 common facets appreciation communication coworkers fringe benefits job conditions nature of the work organization personal growth policies and procedures promotion opportunities recognition security and supervision
lines.name: English

lines.value: hulin and judge 2003 have noted that job satisfaction includes multidimensional psychological responses to an individual's job and that these personal responses have cognitive evaluative affective or emotional and behavioral components
lines.name: English

lines.value: job satisfaction scales vary in the extent to which they assess the affective feelings about the job or the cognitive assessment of the job
lines.name: English

lines.value: affective job satisfaction is a subjective construct representing an emotional feeling individuals have about their job
lines.name: English

lines.value: hence affective job satisfaction for individuals reflects the degree of pleasure or happiness their job in general induces
lines.name: English

lines.value: cognitive job satisfaction is a more objective and logical evaluation of various facets of a job
lines.name: English

lines.value: cognitive job satisfaction can be unidimensional if it comprises evaluation of just one facet of a job such as pay or maternity leave or multidimensional if two or more facets of a job are simultaneously evaluated
lines.name: English

lines.value: cognitive job satisfaction does not assess the degree of pleasure or happiness that arises from specific job facets but rather gauges the extent to which those job facets are judged by the job holder to be satisfactory in comparison with objectives they themselves set or with other jobs
lines.name: English

lines.value: while cognitive job satisfaction might help to bring about affective job satisfaction the two constructs are distinct not necessarily directly related and have different antecedents and consequences
lines.name: English

lines.value: job satisfaction can also be seen within the broader context of the range of issues which affect an individual's experience of work or their quality of working life
lines.name: English

lines.value: job satisfaction can be understood in terms of its relationships with other key factors such as general well being stress at work control at work home work interface and working conditions
lines.name: English

lines.value: the assessment of job satisfaction through employee anonymous surveys became commonplace in the 1930s
lines.name: English

lines.value: although prior to that time there was the beginning of interest in employee attitudes there were only a handful of studies published
lines.name: English

lines.value: latham and budworth note that uhrbrock in 1934 was one of the first psychologists to use the newly developed attitude measurement techniques to assess factory worker attitudes
lines.name: English

lines.value: they also note that in 1935 hoppock conducted a study that focused explicitly on job satisfaction that is affected by both the nature of the job and relationships with coworkers and supervisors
lines.name: English

lines.value: edwin a locke's range of affect theory 1976 is arguably the most famous job satisfaction model
lines.name: English

lines.value: the main premise of this theory is that satisfaction is determined by a discrepancy between what one wants in a job and what one has in a job
lines.name: English

lines.value: further the theory states that how much one values a given facet of work e.g the degree of autonomy in a position moderates how satisfied dissatisfied one becomes when expectations are aren't met
lines.name: English

lines.value: when a person values a particular facet of a job his satisfaction is more greatly impacted both positively when expectations are met and negatively when expectations are not met compared to one who doesn't value that facet
lines.name: English

lines.value: to illustrate if employee a values autonomy in the workplace and employee b is indifferent about autonomy then employee a would be more satisfied in a position that offers a high degree of autonomy and less satisfied in a position with little or no autonomy compared to employee b this theory also states that too much of a particular facet will produce stronger feelings of dissatisfaction the more a worker values that facet
lines.name: English

lines.value: the dispositional approach suggests that individuals vary in their tendency to be satisfied with their jobs in other words job satisfaction is to some extent an individual trait
lines.name: English

lines.value: this approach became a notable explanation of job satisfaction in light of evidence that job satisfaction tends to be stable over time and across careers and jobs
lines.name: English

lines.value: research also indicates that identical twins raised apart have similar levels of job satisfaction
lines.name: English

lines.value: a significant model that narrowed the scope of the dispositional approach was the core self evaluations model proposed by timothy a judge edwin a locke and cathy c durham in 1997
lines.name: English

lines.value: judge et al argued that there are four core self evaluations that determine one's disposition towards job satisfaction self esteem general self efficacy locus of control and neuroticism
lines.name: English

lines.value: this model states that higher levels of self esteem the value one places on his her self and general self efficacy the belief in one's own competence lead to higher work satisfaction
lines.name: English

lines.value: having an internal locus of control believing one has control over her\his own life as opposed to outside forces having control leads to higher job satisfaction
lines.name: English

lines.value: finally lower levels of neuroticism lead to higher job satisfaction
lines.name: English

lines.value: equity theory shows how a person views fairness in regard to social relationships such as with an employer
lines.name: English

lines.value: a person identifies the amount of input things gained from a relationship compared to the output things given to produce an input output ratio
lines.name: English

lines.value: they then compare this ratio to the ratio of other people in deciding whether or not they have an equitable relationship
lines.name: English

lines.value: equity theory suggests that if an individual thinks there is an inequality between two social groups or individuals the person is likely to be distressed because the ratio between the input and the output are not equal
lines.name: English

lines.value: for example consider two employees who work the same job and receive the same pay and benefits
lines.name: English

lines.value: if one individual gets a pay raise for doing the same work as the other then the less benefited individual will become distressed in his workplace
lines.name: English

lines.value: if on the other hand both individuals get pay raises and new responsibilities then the feeling of equity will be maintained
lines.name: English

lines.value: other psychologists have extended the equity theory suggesting three behavioral response patterns to situations of perceived equity or inequity huseman hatfield & mile 1987 o'neil & mone 1998
lines.name: English

lines.value: these three types are benevolent equity sensitive and entitled
lines.name: English

lines.value: the level by each type affects motivation job satisfaction and job performance
lines.name: English

lines.value: the concept of discrepancy theory is to explain the ultimate source of anxiety and dejection
lines.name: English

lines.value: an individual who has not fulfilled his responsibility feels the sense of anxiety and regret for not performing well
lines.name: English

lines.value: they will also feel dejection due to not being able to achieve their hopes and aspirations
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to this theory all individuals will learn what their obligations and responsibilities are for a particular function and if they fail to fulfill those obligations then they are punished
lines.name: English

lines.value: over time these duties and obligations consolidate to form an abstracted set of principles designated as a self guide
lines.name: English

lines.value: agitation and anxiety are the main responses when an individual fails to achieve the obligation or responsibility
lines.name: English

lines.value: this theory also explains that if achievement of the obligations is obtained then the reward can be praise approval or love
lines.name: English

lines.value: these achievements and aspirations also form an abstracted set of principles referred to as the ideal self guide
lines.name: English

lines.value: when the individual fails to obtain these rewards they begin to have feelings of dejection disappointment or even depression

lines.value: frederick herzberg's two factor theory also known as motivator hygiene theory attempts to explain satisfaction and motivation in the workplace
lines.name: English

lines.value: this theory states that satisfaction and dissatisfaction are driven by different factors - motivation and hygiene factors respectively
lines.name: English

lines.value: an employee's motivation to work is continually related to job satisfaction of a subordinate
lines.name: English

lines.value: motivation can be seen as an inner force that drives individuals to attain personal and organizational goals hoskinson porter & wrench p 133
lines.name: English

lines.value: motivating factors are those aspects of the job that make people want to perform and provide people with satisfaction for example achievement in work recognition promotion opportunities
lines.name: English

lines.value: these motivating factors are considered to be intrinsic to the job or the work carried out
lines.name: English

lines.value: hygiene factors include aspects of the working environment such as pay company policies supervisory practices and other working conditions
lines.name: English

lines.value: herzberg's model has stimulated much research
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the 1970s researchers were unable to reliably empirically prove the model however with hackman & oldham suggesting that herzberg's original formulation of the model may have been a methodological artifact
lines.name: English

lines.value: . however emerging studies have a new found interest in the theory particularly among employees in the public sector and among certain professions such as nurses holmberg 2016
lines.name: English

lines.value: the theory has been criticized because it does not consider individual differences conversely predicting all employees will react in an identical manner to changes in motivating hygiene factors
lines.name: English

lines.value: the model has also been criticised in that it does not specify how motivating hygiene factors are to be measured
lines.name: English

lines.value: most studies use a quantitative approach by for example using validated instruments such as the minnesota satisfaction questionnaire weiss et al 1967 there are also studies that have utilized a qualitative methodology such as by means of individual interviews holmberg et al 2017

lines.value: the five core job characteristics can be combined to form a motivating potential score mps for a job which can be used as an index of how likely a job is to affect an employee's attitudes and behaviors

lines.value: one of the most important aspects of an individual's work in a modern organization concerns the management of communication demands that he or she encounters on the job
lines.name: English

lines.value: demands can be characterized as a communication load which refers to the rate and complexity of communication inputs an individual must process in a particular time frame individuals in an organization can experience communication over load and communication under load which can affect their level of job satisfaction
lines.name: English

lines.value: communication overload can occur when an individual receives too many messages in a short period of time which can result in unprocessed information or when an individual faces more complex messages that are more difficult to process
lines.name: English

lines.value: due to this process given an individual's style of work and motivation to complete a task when more inputs exist than outputs the individual perceives a condition of overload which can be positively or negatively related to job satisfaction
lines.name: English

lines.value: in comparison communication under load can occur when messages or inputs are sent below the individual's ability to process them according to the ideas of communication over load and underload if an individual does not receive enough input on the job or is unsuccessful in processing these inputs the individual is more likely to become dissatisfied aggravated and unhappy with their work which leads to a low level of job satisfaction

lines.value: psychological well being pwb is defined as the overall effectiveness of an individual's psychological functioning as related to primary facets of one's life work family community etc there are three defining characteristics of pwb

lines.value: first it is a phenomenological event meaning that people are happy when they subjectively believe themselves to be so

lines.name: English

lines.value: particularly psychologically well people are more prone to experience positive emotions and less prone to experience negative emotions

lines.value: third well being refers to one's life as a whole
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is a global evaluation

lines.value: ipwb asks respondents to reply to a series a questions on how often they felt pleased about accomplishing something bored depressed or unhappy etc pwb in the workplace plays an important role in determining job satisfaction and has attracted much research attention in recent years

lines.value: enheduanna sumerian also transliterated as enheduana en hedu ana or variants fl 23rd century bc is the earliest known poet whose name has been recorded

lines.value: she was the high priestess of the goddess inanna and the moon god nanna sin

lines.value: she lived in the sumerian city state of ur

lines.value: enheduanna's contributions to sumerian literature definitively ascribed to her include several personal devotions to inanna and a collection of hymns known as the sumerian temple hymns

lines.name: English

lines.value: this makes her the first named author in world history

lines.value: she was the first known woman to hold the title of en a role of great political importance that was often held by royal daughters

lines.value: she was appointed to the role by her father king sargon of akkad

lines.value: her mother was probably queen tashlultum

lines.value: enheduanna composed 42 hymns addressed to temples across sumer and akkad including eridu sippar and esnunna

lines.value: the chinese people's liberation army forces hong kong building abbreviated as pla forces hong kong building is a 113 metre 371 ft tall 28-floor building located within the former hms tamar naval base on lung wui road admiralty hong kong

lines.value: it serves as the headquarters of the people's liberation army hong kong garrison
lines.name: English

lines.value: the building is still popularly known by its old name as the prince of wales building  and is located adjacent to the tamar site
lines.name: English

lines.value: constructed in 1979 the building was named the prince of wales building
lines.name: English

lines.value: it housed the head office of the british army stationed in hong kong until the territory's handover to the people's republic of china on 1 july 1997 when it was made the head office of the pla hong kong garrison
lines.name: English

lines.value: in may 2000 the legislative council of hong kong passed the military installations closed areas amendment order 2000 which renamed the former prince of wales barracks to central barracks and the prince of wales building to the chinese people's liberation army forces hong kong building

lines.value: after the base became the central barracks the old name of the building remained visible in large raised letters along the bottom of the tower for several years

lines.value: due to its distinctive shape likened to a wineglass the building stands out from the rest of the admiralty waterfront buildings

lines.value: architects attribute the shape of the building to passive protection its narrow stem with the protruding upper storeys supposedly makes it difficult to climb or attack

lines.value: kevin c ashman born 2 november 1959 is an english quiz player

lines.value: eric henry liddell (; 16 january 1902 - 21 february 1945 was a scottish olympic gold medalist runner rugby union international player and christian missionary
lines.name: English

lines.value: liddell was born in china to scottish missionary parents
lines.name: English

lines.value: he attended boarding school near london spending time when possible with his family in edinburgh and afterwards attended the university of edinburgh
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the 1924 summer olympics in paris liddell refused to run in the heats for his favoured 100 metres because they were held on a sunday
lines.name: English

lines.value: instead he competed in the 400 metres held on a weekday a race that he won
lines.name: English

lines.value: he returned to china in 1925 to serve as a missionary teacher
lines.name: English

lines.value: aside from two furloughs in scotland he remained in china until his death in a japanese civilian internment camp in 1945
lines.name: English

lines.value: liddell's olympic training and racing and the religious convictions that influenced him are depicted in the oscar winning 1981 film chariots of fire in which he is portrayed by fellow scot ian charleson
lines.name: English

lines.value: eric liddell often called the flying scotsman after the record breaking locomotive was born 16 january 1902 in tientsin china the second son of the reverend and mrs james dunlop liddell scottish missionaries with the london missionary society
lines.name: English

lines.value: liddell went to school in china until the age of five
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the age of six he and his eight year old brother robert were enrolled in eltham college a boarding school in south london for the sons of missionaries
lines.name: English

lines.value: their parents and sister jenny returned to china
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the boys time at eltham their parents sister and new brother ernest came home on furlough two or three times and were able to be together as a family mainly living in edinburgh
lines.name: English

lines.value: at eltham liddell was an outstanding athlete earning the blackheath cup as the best athlete of his year and playing for the first xi and the first xv by the age of 15 later becoming captain of both the cricket and rugby union teams
lines.name: English

lines.value: his headmaster george robertson described him as being entirely without vanity while at the university of edinburgh liddell became well known for being the fastest runner in scotland
lines.name: English

lines.value: newspapers carried stories of his feats at track meets and many articles stated that he was a potential olympic winner
lines.name: English

lines.value: liddell was chosen to speak for glasgow students evangelistic union by one of the gseu's co founders dp thomson because he was a devout christian
lines.name: English

lines.value: the gseu hoped that he would draw large crowds to hear the gospel
lines.name: English

lines.value: the gseu would send out a group of eight to ten men to an area where they would stay with the local population
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was liddell's job to be lead speaker and to evangelize to the men of scotland
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1920 liddell joined his brother robert at the university of edinburgh to study pure science
lines.name: English

lines.value: athletics and rugby played a large part in his university life
lines.name: English

lines.value: he ran in the 100 yards and 220 yards races for the university and played rugby for the university club from which he gained a place in the backline of a strong scotland national rugby union team
lines.name: English

lines.value: he scored four tries for scotland
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1922 and 1923 he played in seven out of eight five nations matches along with a l gracie
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1923 he won the aaa championships in athletics in the 100 yards setting a british record of 9.7 seconds that would not be equalled for 23 years and 220 yards 21.6 seconds
lines.name: English

lines.value: he graduated with a bachelor of science degree after the paris olympiad in 1924
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 1924 summer olympics were hosted by the city of paris

lines.value: a devout christian liddell refused to run in a heat held on sunday the christian sabbath and was forced to withdraw from the 100-metres race his best event

lines.value: the schedule had been published several months earlier and his decision was made well before the games

lines.value: liddell spent the intervening months training for the 400 metres though his best pre olympics time of 49.6 seconds set in winning the 1924 aaa championship 440 yards was modest by international standards

lines.value: reading it later he found the message in the old book it says he that honours me i will honour wishing you the best of success always recognising the slightly misquoted reference to 1 samuel 2:30 liddell was profoundly moved that someone other than his coach believed in him and the stance he had taken

lines.value: the 400 metres had been considered a middle distance event in which runners raced round the first bend and coasted through the back leg

lines.value: inspired by the biblical message and deprived of a view of the other runners because he drew the outside lane liddell raced the whole of the first 200 metres to be well clear of the favoured americans

lines.value: a few days earlier liddell had competed in the 200 metre finals for which he received the bronze medal behind americans jackson scholz and charles paddock beating british rival and teammate harold abrahams who finished in sixth place
